newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-Bombay rally drives India GDR gains.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-Bombay rally drives India GDR gains.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts pushed higher on Monday, on the back of strong gains in Bombay earlier, which saw stocks climb to 34 month highs.
Traders said the local market had gained on high liquidity levels, although GDR trade remained relatively limited.
Among key stocks, Reliance added 50 cents to $23.75/24.75, and SBI collected 52 cents to $10.37/11.12.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed 2.79 points firmer at 91.30, a 3.15 percent rise, with the premium over the local market at 24.28 percent from 23.23 percent.
The Cazenove Indian GDR index added 1.96 points to 99.19 -- a 22.49 percent premium to the local market. It measures from midday on the previous trading day to midday today.
Bombay's benchmark index rose 118.05 points to 4,465.37.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index made 2.43 points, or 1.70 percent, to 145.29, representing a discount to the local market of 0.87 percent.

The gains followed another strong run for electronics stocks in Taipei, which added 1.6 percent on the day. The overall market succumbed to profit-taking by the close to end 16.86 points up at 10,065.76.
The HSBC James Capel Korea GDR Index added 1.57 points to 75.52 points, a premium of 47.59 percent over the local market.
